Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Renovated Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Shaen J
Reviews.Content: The Room was brand new! state of the art appliances, furniture and leminate floors. I have stayed at this property before and they are really changing things up for the better. The new rooms are Perfect well done! Bathrooms are brand new!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, functional but inelegant”
Reviews.Author: c-programmer
Reviews.Content: Entering into the hotel is disappointing, as the carpets are old and, as far as I could see, only one of the three elevators was running. Over three days it was always the center. Maybe the others are in use and I should by a loto ticket... The room was clean, smelled good, the bed was made two out of the three days. It is functional instead of luxurious, and, if function is what you need, then this is a very well placed hotel that gives you lots of room. The wireless internet is a pay for service, but was, at times, painfully slow with my connection to websites going down, even though my connection to the access point was very good... Possibly a lot of people on a standard asdl line. You have a working mini fridge and kitchen, with pouch coffee and white stuff. The parking garage was convenient and in and out is a given The bedroom was separated from the living room by french doors, better decorated and quite comfortable. The blackout drapes worked well, and there is an attainable balcony if you need great location and elbow room then this is your place, if you need class and elegance, not so much..

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE WORST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disgusted154914
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel ever. It should be condemned. The room was filthy, with bugs crawling on the kitchen floor. The bathroom was disgusting and the maids never swept anything. When we first arrived we were given room 801 and that carpet was so dirty I wouldn't let my dog stay there. We called the front desk and wanted a renovated room. We were given 901 which was not upgraded. The only difference was parkay on the floor instead of carpet. We had to stack luggage at the door because the lock was broken. The window sills were absolutely filled with dirt as were the windows. We had to purchase lysol wipes to wipe the phones down before we used them. The fights outside the building kept us up for 3 hours and we called the desk to call the police...but nothing was done. So we checked out early and found a 200% better hotel one block west on Charles. This definitely was the worst ever. Elevators took 20 minutes. If you like the smell of fried onions and food 24/7 then this is the place for you. With all the construction on the north side of the building it should be closed. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!!! The rates were certainly cheap, but they should have refunded our entire 3 night stay....would not have a bath here...could not even get the shower to work. just gross...do not waste your time or money at the town inn!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: joefin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location downtown, the rooms were big, and the balcony was nice, but those are about the only good things about it. The kitchen needed a new coat of paint desperately and half of the cabinets have an inch of dust. The shower had awful water pressure and there were hairs in the shower. At 460$ for three nights, the 12$ wifi and 22$ parking for every night seemed excessive to me. The elevators were terribly slow, there was more than one occasion where I waited for ten minutes for one to come. I will not be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “BAD place ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeni A
Reviews.Content: this place is the wors ever t!!!! TERRIBLE PLACE (1) There are construction in the hotel and outside. all the days horrible noise!!! every day on the week!!! incluse Friday, Saturday and Sunday! from 8:00.a.m till 19:00.p.m. you can not do anything with this noises!!!! anything!!! even not to read or watch TV! they don't care!!! (2) The elevators doesn't work! you can wait 1/2 an hour! and even more!!! (3) The rooms are dirty! (4) The service terrible! (5) The laundry place have only 3 machines and most of the time it is not available!!!!!!! (6) I could not sleep because the bed is not comftreble at all!!!! and a lot more!!!! it the worst place ever!!!! do not come this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was left on hold for 20 minutes with no explanation/apology???”
Reviews.Author: Pallavi K
Reviews.Content: This would be my first time staying at Town Inn and if my first experience is to go by anything, I am not looking forward to it at all!! I called the day before my reservation to confirm everything was good to go for next day. Called [--] and pressed 1 for reservation, when a lady answered me and right after finding out why I was calling, I was put on hold. Everything normal here, except I was ON HOLD for 20 minutes plus!!!! I am in Customer Service myself and this is unacceptable. I ended up calling from my other phone and reached the same lady again( I was still holding on other line all this time)When I told her that she put me on hold and haven't gotten back to me for 20 minutes, her response was "Awww, I am not sure what happened but how can I help you?" No apology, no explanation!! By that time I was in no mood to talk or ask for any help. I actually had to ask her name myself because she didn't even bother introducing herself. The name was "Chris" and it appalled me that she had absolutely no remorse over leaving me on hold on a Long distance call!! This is ridiculous and Town Inn staff needs to be given a lesson in hospitality. Not happy at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. You are better off sleeping in your car!”
Reviews.Author: WBeaupre
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were meeting our son in Torontomfor a short visit. Normally we stay at the Sutton Place Hotel but this time I decided to stay at the Town Inn for nostagic reasons. Thirty years ago when he was six we stayed at the Town Inn and had a wonderful time. The rooms were good, the location central and the swimming pool was fantastic. This time I checked the hotel web site to learn that the hotel had been completely refurbished in the last year. Because of the web site and particularly the photographs of the updated suites we booked a two bedroom suite for two nights. Upon arrival we were informed that all the balconies on the north side of the property were under renovation. Not only were many of the balconies missing there was a warning posted in the lobby that there could be considerable demolition noise between 9:00 and 4:00. We were given a suite on the opposite side of the building with assurances that the noise would not be a factor. When we arrived at our supposedly refurbished suite we were greeted with a suite that had definitely seen much better days. The room was not properly cleaned. The floors, window sills and furniture were dusty. The kitchen counter was badly damage as if an electrical appliance had shorted out and burned. Both the range and fridge were old and dirty. There was a large closet in the suite that contained four old ripped and filty mattresses and box springs that were obviously being stored there instead of in the garbage where they belonged. If that was not enough, the room had a definite musty odour. When I complained to the front desk they offered to upgrade us to two one bedroom suites as no other two bedroom units were available. Unfortunately the new suites were on the construction side of the building and in one of them the balcony had been demolished but the door from the living area was not only unlocked but open. A small child could easily have wandered through the open door and fallen 15 stories! While these new rooms were somewhat better they also had a distinct unpleasant ordour as did the hallways and elevators throughout the hotel. Needles to say we refused to stay and checked out immediately. This property should close its doors until they have truly refurbished and demolition construction is complete. The amazing thing is that they are charging $189/night plus $20 for underground parking. So you might be asking the question:"What did you do?" it's simple. I called the Sutton Place and booked into a two bedroom suite for $262/night (parking included). Something I should have done in the first place. You may or may not be able to home again but you should defintely never go to the Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tbrat2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town Inn Suites on December 30, 2011 - January 2, 2012. When we arrived they gave us room 306 and we walked in and were pleasantly surprised to see a kitchen and balcony. But the surprises didn't end there... the kitchen utensils were dirty and just sitting in the living room we felt dirty and we had only been there for a couple hours. The next morning I woke up to find a bed bug on the sheet that I had just been cuddling with. I jumped up and ran to the washroom in total disgust. My friend and I checked the bed and found 5 more bugs, some were brown and some were red, which means they had fed. Ughhh just the memory of it grosses me out and its 3 weeks later. I called the front desk to let them know what we had found and asked them how they were going to handle this; since now I was terrified that I was going to bring them home. The front desk girl spoke to her manager and called me back. They upgraded us to a luxury suite on th 20th floor (which meant a minimum wait of 15 mins for the elevator cause it was so slow) and gave us a free breakfast (which sucked and took way to long for them to cook and when it finally came out the bacon was burnt) and they gave us money and detergent to do our laundry and then garbage bags to put all our clean clothes in. So much for site seeing that day, we spent the whole day doing laundry. Hell I could of done that at home. lol The housekeeping surpervisor came with us to check out the luxury suite. We lifted the mattress to make sure there were no bugs and thank god there was not. The supervisor went on to explain that the rooms on the lower floors are sometimes rented out a month at a time and the people that rent those rooms dont always tell the hotel if they find bugs. I dont care what she said... it was obvisious that, that room had not been cleaned or checked before they rented it out to the next people because if it had... housekeeping would of seen those bugs. I understand that bed bugs are pretty much everywhere now but come on... do yourself a favour and pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: SydCityBoy
Reviews.Content: Room was on a low floor, room smelt. Windows were absolutely filthy, as if they hadn't been cleaned in YEARS. Kitchenette was under-equipped. Television in main area was right out of the 1990's. A few light globes didn't work. Workmen making noise early in the morning, drilling/construction. I didn't dare experience the 'breakfast'. Could not wait to get out of there. Staff were nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wayy past it's prime”
Reviews.Author: Loriesco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a bachlorette party that I had nothing to do with organinzing. Room's were spacious but the hotel is like an old apartment building turned into a hotel. Upon our arrival the first thing out of the gentleman's mouth wasn't "how are you today, or hello" it was there is a zero noise policy in affect here :/ ummmm ok did someone not tell him we were having a bachlorette party here? I thought for sure we would be looking for another place to rest our heads at the end of the night. Much to my surprise we didn't get kicked out. The party was held in a "suite" Much more like a larger version of a dorm room. Our double room was ok. The balcony's were a little sketchy and as soon as we got in our room I was the first one to jump in the shower and about 5 minutes in the water went cold. Needless to say I had to cut my shower short and the 2 other girls I was in the room with had about enough time to get wet and get out. We had to call down to the front desk to let them know that our closet door wasn't hanging anymore. It was resting up against the wall and we didn't want them to think we trashed the place. The front desk man didn't seem too surprised. For the price we paid I was totally unsatisfied. I would not go back to this hotel even if it was $100 cheaper than all the rest. On the day of departure we got stuck in the elevator. It kept going up then down the up then down eeeksss I wasn't too impressed especially when I wasn't feeling the greatest. I'm not a negative person and I usually take things with a grain of salt but this place was down right dirty and way past it's prime.

Reviews.Title: “Great But for One Important Aspect”
Reviews.Author: bellesque
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town Inn suites in Toronto for 3 nights. It has a lot going for it: central location; suites that are like little apartments with lots of rooms and equipped, 'breakfast' (continental) included; pool and exercise room; free Internet off the lobby (charged in the room). What it lacked was cleanliness. The coffee pot and a cup had not been washed. The bed sheet had been used (lipstick stain and hair), which, because I was exhausted from travel and arrived near midnight and didn't get to bed until around 2 am, I didn't notice until the next day and yes, major ICK!). The towels were suspect. I think this was not the hotel's fault but the maid's. I believe this person took an easy route and either forgot to clean this room (though the bed was made) or the previous occupant left early or worst case the maid was trying to 'get away' with something. I didn't take the chance so for my 3 nights I put the 'no maid service' on the door, preferring to make my own bed rather than feel that it was all iffy. The hotel was good about this, so I can't fault them. It's an inexpensive hotel for Toronto and you won't likely get these prices and amenities elsewhere in the city. Just check that everything is clean when you get to the room. Wish I'd hadn't been so exhausted and had done that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, but very run down”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: Outside appearance was very poor and run down. Rooms were dirty and poorly cleaned. Parking is a total rip off and the garage is scary! Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Big space but worth the price?”
Reviews.Author: prvixen
Reviews.Content: Town Inn Suites is located in the sketchier part of Yonge and Bloor but conveniently located downtown. The building is hard to find and quite a walk from the subway station. The price is expensive but easy to swallow if you're having 10-20 people stay in your room overnight. Loved the "suite" aspect of it since almost everyone (couples included) got their own bed. The balcony is a hazard. If you live in or near Toronto, just foot the price and time for a cab or public transportation rather than paying to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sean4006
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and frankly was scared to check into here. But the rate was good. 108$ for a 950 sqft room. I can't believe the complaints on here! My room was friggin huge!! It is like a 1 bedroom apartment with a separate kitchen, living room, and dining room. The lack of updating isn't bad. The reviewers here are rediculous! Its not a 5 star hotel. And it's not 600$ a night. But the amount of space is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “A very mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: Trip/Advisor Toronto Hotel Town Inn Furnished Suites. Great location. Central and convenient to everything. Within walking distance to countless restaurants of all nationalities on Yonge St. The hugest, best and cleanest grocery store anywhere (Bloorstreet Market) at 55 Bloor St. West. Next to a rather impressive liquor store, LCBO. Check on their opening hours. (The Canadians have hang-ups on liquor dispensation.) High-fallutin international shopping on Bloor St. Great. Pleasant reception. Pleasant, helpful room maid. The room a big apartment, must have started as a condo. Fully furnished and equipped including kitchen. End of it. The room has zero ambience. The balcony hasnâ€™t been stepped on in years. Several things didnâ€™t work, but a note at the front desk fixed most of them. Prehistoric light bulbs dating back to Tomas Edison. Never mind environmentally friendly electricity-saving CFL bulbs. The elevators are slow and sometimes donâ€™t work at all. 30 stories. The continental breakfast, included. I donâ€™t know what continent they referring to. Iâ€™ve never seen such a skimpy one. Located in an abandoned restaurant at the end of a poorly-lit walkway in the basement. No buffet. Along comes a small portion of freshly-cut fruit with two slices of butter-dripping, mushy toast, a cellophane-packed muffin with cellophane butter and jamâ€”served by a pretty gal. Juice: $2. Asking for water delivers some in a lukewarm, heavy coffee mug. Hey, you get a big, clean apartment in a good location at a reasonable price. 55 Bloor St

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Booked the 2 Junior Beds Suite. Luckily i checked in late as i can see the front desk getting clogged up by early check ins... The lobby is very small and not so welcoming. More looks like an apartment than a hotel. The elevator is very rundown and looks like it can freeze on any floor anytime. The room we checked into was very SPACIOUS!! The suite was a one bedroom with a double bed in the room with a closet, the other double bed was out in the living room which wasn't appealing. There was a kitchen which included a stove, dishwasher, huge fridge. There was also a closet in the front and a storage room which was nice. Also a small 2 person dining table and chairs. Also a balcony which needed massive cleaning didn't step out at all. The heating in this hotel is bad it doesn't flow into the one bedroom at all. Was cold in the room. The front desk couldn't book us another room but did try to fix the furnace which worked! For one night it was an alright stay. Was pretty pricey but if your with a family of 4 this room is perfect for the space. The bed was comfortable and pillows were nice. Had a good sleep. I would definitely stay at this hotel again because of the spacious and comfortable rooms. The carpet does need cleaning so do walls, windows, and balcony!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Unsatisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: danimilburn
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in my stay at this hotel. The staff were very rude to me, there were no toiletries in the room and I requested some but was never given any.. I also left almost $100 CDN in the room and called shortly after leaving the hotel and was told that is was not there. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who expects to be treated with respect.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a hotel snob don't stay here, but if you're looking for something cheap then go for it!”
Reviews.Author: LizziM_11
Reviews.Content: The room for the amount that we paid was really good (compared to the other prices we looked at around and closer to downtown toronto). It was well conveniently located, as long as you are willing to walk, I would not recommend to elders without a wheelchair, if they want to get around. Me and my family had the suites, equipped with a kitchen, and dining area, which was really helpful, and allowed us save some money! Although it was not all up-to-date, in my opinion it was fine, ok simple things could improve it greatly, but it was to be expected for the price. (I would very much recommend a car as well to get around in toronto ( you will see soooo much more)) The bad points are, the old air con units were very noisy, but worked very well! We just put them on for half an hour when we got in and before bed! Balconys were dirty and not really nice to be out on, although views were amazing! There were no rugs on the floors, which made it echoey, I would recommend taking slippers, or slippersocks. We had some dirty towels come to us, which we took down to recpetion and complained about and they did replace quickly and efficiently. The maids trolleys seemed to stay on each floor, so you could take things yourself. We tried the 'continental breakfast' one morning, and I wouldn't recommend it, its just a slice of toast, fruit and a muffin, we just got cereal and milk from the store. Lastly, the lifts took foreverrrrr to come, we had a suite above one another, so as we took teh stairs, one floor down and as we passed pressed the lift button, then by the time we'd got the rest of our party out the suite the lift was just coming. Overall I would recommend paying that little bit more money and getting something else, especially if you knwo you are a hotel snob, if you're just a young group for a couple of nights out, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: jamessebesta
Reviews.Content: Remember the first basement apartment you had, this is it. Don't be fooled by the website. unless you are a 20 something and drunk, do not sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel V
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short -- i decided to book a room at this hotel for two nights because of the location and the deal I got online. NOT worth it. The rooms are "renovated" in the sense that they have put up curtains to block the old balcony and redone the floors in the living room and bedroom. However, the bathroom was gross - shower curtain, paint and floors needed to be replaced. The water went hot then cold then hot. The hallway carpets are old, the restaurant is in the labyrinth-like basement and serves mediocre food. We decided it wasnt "that" bad, until I woke up the first morning with bites all over me. It wasnt until they got worse the next morning that I realized the were BED BUGS!!! I left rather quietly because the hotel staff were very nice and I didnt want to cause a scene. The manager did call me back, after my third message. And he refunded me half of my stay -- not great, but better than nothing. I will not return to this hotel and do not recommend that you stay here unless you thoroughly check the bed for bugs... If i had not gotten the bug bites, I would have rated the room a little higher. Even though it was out of date and not what I expected, the kitchenette was convenient and the location was central. The pool also seemed to be ok... we went down the labyrinth to check it out and there is an outside patio, which would have been nice I assume.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it but for a few exceptions!”
Reviews.Author: TandJ2011_07
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is ideal and the rate was reasonable. The staff was quite helpful and friendly _ desk, housekeeping and resturant. We also liked the spaciousness of the suite and the quite comfortable bed. Air conditioning worked great! Bathroom was clean and shower worked well. As for the elevator, except for a few occasions, the wait was short. However, we weren't pleased with the condition of the carpeting. We feel that if the carpet were either cleaned after each occupant or even replaced, it was be more receptive to occupants. It would also be quite nice if chairs were placed on the balcony. Upgrading TV and stove would be a good addition.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: barefootboogie
Reviews.Content: Toronto is severely lacking in apartment hotels which offer very short term periods of stay. Places like the Delsuites are cheaper and far, far superior in every way to the Town Inn, but require a 30 day minimum stay. This is why I ended up booking a Junior Queen Suite at the Town Inn for 17 days last July (although I left after day 5 and went to The Grange). My priority was an apartment with a proper kitchen and separate sleeping area, not too far from downtown, for about $150 per night. The experience sort of reminded me of my student days. Dingy run-down building, old, broken, furniture and fittings, peeling wallpaper, filthy windows, and ingrained dirt which can never be cleaned. A freezing cold then scalding hot shower. A kitchen which was so old it could conceivably be called "retro" by a imaginative estate agent, and one which really stretched the meaning of "fully equipped" - Old Mother Hubbardâ€™s Cupboard was a veritable Aladdinâ€™s Cave next to this place (no sharp knives, no plates!, one small bowl, no corkscrew etc etc). If I was a single guy there is no way I would take a girl back there. Not a live one anyhow. I would be more worried about what i might catch off the sofa, than off the date. And if you are a professional who is questioning where their career and life is going - this is not the place to forget those concerns. The well meaning excuse given to me by the front desk was that "probably the last occupant had been a long term resident and they hadn't had a chance to refurbish". They were obliging in getting me a knife and plate, but a colander, I was told, they didn't have. For what you get it is very bad value. Paying extra for the internet also adds insult to injury. One plus point, is the staff, who were helpful and courteous, but sadly there is only so much they can do, and short of learning how to fit new kitchens, it's just not going to be enough. There is no quick fix to this place. The whole building from the parking lot, to the elevators, to the balconies, needs to be re-done. A final note: The TownInn website is shockingly misleading with it's pictures and i seriously doubt the efficacy of some of the reviews which gave this place high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: azephyrgirl
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks were not friendly or helpful. They acted like it was their first time in Toronto when I asked where local places were. They also charged me for the internet and I never got online. They gave me a 1800 number to call to get online and even they couldn't get me online. I told the clerk not to charge me, but he did. When I saw that it still showed on my bill and called to get a refund of the $12 for the internet I never had, they were rude and said they were not going to give me a refund. They had a lot of wandering people in and out of the hotel that seemed to live there. I think it is an apartment too. One guy walking in and out of the hotel was talking to himself like right out of a scary movie. He obviously wasn't staying there but the staff seemed not to care- they just ignored him. The rooms are old and dirty. The ac unit smelled up the whole place and the bed was hard and uncomfortable. I could have tolerated the hotel if the staff had been kind and sincere, or tolerated the staff if the hotel was nice, but haven't both so dissatisfactory made for a miserable stay. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKiwi
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely outdated, felt damp and smelt mouldy. Overpriced given the lack of amenties and state of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Real Apartment Hotel which accepts pets”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: This is true apartment hotel in the sense that it was use to be an Apartment building which was purchased and turned into a hotel. Except for the front desk, you feel as you are walking into an apartment building. It is a little outdated but they have attempted to modernize it by adding newer style furniture. The AC is loud. Good location, as it is a couple blocks from Bloor & Yonge Streets or from the gay village.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: TanyaCoutts
Reviews.Content: The rooms (apartment) was ok, stayed in better and have to say that i'm glad we weren't in the room too much. Great area though. Would look for better standard if travelling to Toronto again - not sure what star they were rated but would personally only five 2*

Reviews.Title: “Passable but wish we'd stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rickpoet
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Town Inn Suites...after reading all of the reviews here I can report that it was basically passable with good value in terms of what was included with our package but overall probably not good for anyone who wants to feel like they're in a nice place. And now the specifics: We got a package on Travelzoo which included full hot breakfast (otherwise $8.95 each per day), parking with in/out priviliges (otherwise $20 a day) and free wi-fi internet (included for everyone I believe. It was $119 a night. Free or even low-priced parking in a nice hotel in Toronto is non-existent...breakfasts at similar or nicer hotels cost roughly $16 - $20 per person, and internet can run $10-$13 per day.) So...in terms of what was offered it really was the best value in Toronto...however... 1) Room (see photos) - I guess it was clean but it didn't feel clean. There were holes in the carpet. Wallpaper was peeling off of the walls in the bathroom and in the space just outside the bathroom between the bedroom and living room. I guess the couches in the living room were updated as they were a dark brown leather kind of material, but the rest of the furniture in the place looked old. The air conditioning control unit was detached from the wall. The sliding closet door in the bedroom wasn't attached well and felt like it would fall off if we actually used it. The balcony was not clean. Couple of scuff marks on the walls. Kitchen had old appliances. This was billed as an "updated" room. I guess it's possible that it was 'updated' far in the past. Didn't feel updated. 2) Wi-Fi - Such an important feature for us when traveling so we can check in with home without racking up international roaming minutes....We also use the net to check on locations we're visiting and buy event tickets, make reservations etc during the vacation...Typically we use the laptop in the bedroom...DSL router was in the living room and my laptop didn't connect at first...called the front desk and they routed me to an offsite technical support help desk. Wow...I'm in the hotel for 5 minutes and I'm now engaged in a technical support call. Eventually I unplugged the DSL router and brought it into the bedroom and plugged it in there...lucky I knew how to arrange the router, phone line filter etc to make it work...from that point the signal worked as we needed it where we wanted it. You'd think though that, in such a tiny one bedroom apartment, there wouldn't be a signal issue going between 2 rooms. 3) Breakfast - I guess they have no-breakfast packages, continental breakfast packages, and fuil hot breakfast packages...I read the reviews here about the twisty hall way to find the breakfast room so I was prepared for it...that didn't really bother me...the restaurant actually shares an entrance with the unique Noir restaurant (dining in the dark experience...blind waiters) so if you wanted to avoid the twisty hall via the lobby you could enter from the street and pretend you going to the nice restaurant. The continental was muffin, fruit and coffee. The full hot breakfast had several items on it but it was limited...no cheese to add to omelettes, either brown or white toast as opposed to any other bread choices....the potatoes were very good...the rest was fine but after a few days we just wanted to feel like we were on vacation at breakfast so we went to the Sunset Grille around the corner on Bloor street (which has a $3.99 breakfast special.)...plenty of other breakfast options in the neighborhood...if you really don't care and just need fuel to go...then this was fine...though if dining is an important part of you vacation experience..then not so fine. 4) Elevator - Not as bad in our experience as in previous reviews. Of all the times we rode up and down to and from the 18th floor...one time we had to wait about 5 minutes...all the other times it came very quickly. (Funnily I was a little disappointed it wasn't awful as I was prepared to get out the stop watch on my fine and time the lengthy elevator waits to report back her...but it was a non-issue.) 5) Staff - Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and nice...any issues the hotel has is not their fault. 6) Location - Decent enough...not exactly downtown (I think they call it mid-town.) Very close to Bloor Yonge Subway which intersects 2 lines and can get you anywhere. relatively easy walk to ROM museum....some restaurants and pubs close by...I think we would have rather stayed closer to downtown though. At the end of the day it met all of our needs...though with 4 star hotels downtown available on Hotwire and Priceline for less than $100 a night, I wish we'd done that and just paid for the parking, and internet and enjoyed breakfast on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Sickening and Repulsive. Will Never Go Back.”
Reviews.Author: JosieMontie
Reviews.Content: Words do not do it justice. This place was utterly disgusting and NOT a family hotel. We could not stay there: noise was unbearable, the carpet was horribly stained, and the furniture looked like that of a haunted house. The furniture was just ugly, very ugly, and no one in their right mind would want to voluntarily live in a place as revolting and repulsive as this. I do not advise anyone; whether it is a family, couple, friends, or anyone in their right mind to live in this appalling place. The service was okay, apart from one receptionist who lacked basic manners; he spoke to us very disrespectfully and we were very offended. The beds were okay, which is probably the only thing that was acceptable in this apartment. The kitchen looked as if cockroaches have crawled on top of it and lived there for years before we entered. We could not cook food or keep our food in the refrigerator because it looked very dirty and very badly maintained. What was even more disgusting was the stains on the counters in the kitchen, parts of which were burned, and others permanently stained with a white substance which I could not recognize.The room service woman was very nice. A small 3x3 inch hole in the wall was their sad excuse of an air conditioner, but to give it justice it did cool the room up a bit. I am warning you NOT to live here; it is hell.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Krystle96
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked the Ramada on Jarvis before settling on this hotel, and it was mostly because when I started typing the hotel name in Google, the most frequent search was "Town Inn Suites Bed Bugs". However, I am glad that I chose the Town Inn Suites. (Especially because I walked past the Ramada on the way back the hotel at 3am, and sure enough, there were prostitutes lined up outside the hotel). But back to the Town Inn Suites, I will be the first to admit that I am a hotel snob, and want to ensure that where I sleep is a clean, rodent/pest free environment. The Town Inn is a remodeled apartment building, >25 floors. It is between the Gay District and Yorkville. We stayed in the 19th floor in a Junior Suites (4 of us), It was worth the price I think, it was pretty much what I expected; relatively clean, and ok for a one night stay, The staff was helpful. The only complaints I have is that the advertised "free" breakfast is an extra $9.95/guest. In addition, as long as you never go anywhere other than your hotel room or the lobby it is safe. It is a long dark twisted route to the eating room. Also an elevator was not working during my stay, and i had to wait almost 20 minutes for one. As an aside, I had left my ipod 16 GB touch in the hotel in the bed. I didnt realize this until I was back at my house, and I must commend the staff, because instead of keeping it and pretending they didnt find it, I called, and after a few verification questions, they confirmed that they had it and would come pick it up. Overall, It was not as bad as I expected, and while it doesnt completely pass my high falutin expectations for a hotel, it is adequate lodgings for a person who wants to stay in toronto on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: PeterDCanada
Reviews.Content: We paid $119 for a one bedroom studio apartment - a bargain for Toronto which included free parking and a full breakfast. However.... hotel is old and not renovated. Suites generally in poor shape. Location is great and staff very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveller-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 days on business because everywhere else was booked up and I wanted to be within walking distance of my workshop. Location is the only plus for this hotel. The room was dirty, lobby is tiny and always crowded, elevators were broken and took forever, wireless internet kept disconnecting, strong smells in common areas and it was noisy. I was on the Penthouse floor # 27 so that helped with me being able to get on the elevator as opposed to others who couldn't fit as it went down. It took forever to get all the way down with only one elevator in service at times. The view was nice but with no patio furniture on the balcony you couldn't stay out and enjoy it. The carpets were filthy! I brought slippers and wore them or shoes in the room. The one time I walked in my bare feet, the bottom of my feet started feeling itchy. I ended up washing everything I brought when I got home, whether I used it or not. It was that dirty. Looking back I should have shared a suite with a co-worker at the Sutton Place Hotel for the same price (once you factored in parking ~ $20/day and internet ~ $12/day plus tax at Town Inn) or been further away and taken a cab. I will never go back no matter the price.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: devotchka83
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Town Inn Suites. It was great to get a suite with a kitchenette, but it was not very well-equipped and I felt the utensils could have been cleaner, so I ended up eating out most of the time. My rooms were a little dated but acceptable and clean, but a friend came to stay in another room on the 27th floor and his rooms were really shabby with old, dirty carpet. They charge for wifi, $12 per 24 hours, but it's really poor quality. I plugged into the ethernet and it was still desperately slow. I may not have minded paying for it if it was reliable. The rate I got included a Continental breakfast. The first morning I went down to the restaurant, I wondered where on earth this dark, dank corridor was leading. The breakfast room is in the very bowels of the building - not a very inspiring start to the day. The breakfast itself is quite good - fresh fruit, toast and coffee - and the breakfast staff are really nice. The female receptionists are great, but two of the male receptionists are beyond rude. The noise from the other guests was my main problem in this hotel. I had to call the front desk at 3.30am because a neighbouring suite was having a huge party. Overall, I'm not sure I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: grandma511
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I was inToronto at a Conference. The room was clean and tidy. The towels and sheets were clean, we were offered clean towels the second day which we declined. We had the continental breakfast for $3.50 and it was good value for money. Ww will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not the cleanest, but excellent rates”
Reviews.Author: AnakMas
Reviews.Content: People tend to be a bit negative when it comes to the Town Inn. I have to confess that the carpet and the couch looked slightly dirty (stains) but the rest looks clean enough. There are fresh towels and sheets every day and the personnel is really friendly. I've never been in a hotel room where I had this much space (living room, kitchen (oven, gas, microwave, sink), bathroom, sleeping room, balcony) for such a low rate. I was at the top floor looking towards downtown Toronto. From my balcony I had an absolutely amazing view over the city. I would definitely book again also because the location is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Been In”
Reviews.Author: mcr0ss
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt one of the worst hotels I've ever been in. I went there for training nearby, and thought the photos on their Web site looked beautiful. The price made me think I could save my company a few dollars, while staying at a great place. The hotel is a shabby, converted apartment building. I got a recently renovated room, and it had a strange smell. The linens on the bed smelled like bug spray. They showed me another room, but it still had that odd odor. The rooms were on different floors, and on each of them there were vacuums and linens left in the bundles on the floor. I woke up after the first night feeling sick as a dog. The staff is helpful when checking in, but not very accomodating after you're there. It was a horrible experience that turned me off of staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price”
Reviews.Author: M1keuk
Reviews.Content: Location is good just a few mins walk from blood station, I had a one bedroom apartment so it was good that there are a number of supermarkets nearby. I was on the 23rd floor out of 25 floors this floor has not been renovated yet but for the price I paid it was a good apartment. Would stay again. Only downside is the cost of the wireless Internet at 14 dollars including tax per day is a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for the money, if you just want a hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Contikho
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel, before picking up my father from the airport. The photos were attractive, the location is excellent, right in downtown, close to various attractions. However, when we got there, not only was I appalled about the shabbiness of the room and the dingy motel-style amenities, when we moved the bed, it was so terribly dirty underneath that it was clear nobody cleaned this room thoroughly for a while. What a dump! An on top of it, my father was there - shame on me! I will never stay in this disgusting place again and hope you are warned.

Reviews.Title: “Be a ware and don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Holapola
Reviews.Content: the service of front desk was fair to good, while the house keeping was horrible we were going out within half an hour and the house keeping lady came and she doen't want to wait, pushed my wife inside the room and start to clean so she can finish and leave. The way she is cleaning was ????? no vaccume and for the bathroom she cleaned the toilet from the same water no detergents. The 2 bed jumior room was good and the kitchen also but it wasn't as clean as it should be. Always use high levels and keep away from the left, their breakfast menu is not so good and there is nothing to dine inside the hotel, you need to buy everything from outside. The location was good but near as they said at the web site. The church street would be an issue specially at night if you are having a a family. The worse thing there was not free internet access you need to pay while most of Canada hotels are for 3 nights free???!?!?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Don't beleive all the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: tta888
Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel in a great location! We booked a package including breakfast and were worried about the previous reviews - they couldnt be more wrong! Beautiful, clean, renovated room with a view of the city and just a few minutes away from all the great shopping and restaurants in Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “pass this one by, there's better out there”
Reviews.Author: MaZDaGiRL7
Reviews.Content: You can totally tell this used to be an apartment building! From the creepy dirty underground parking, to the small shaky elevators, to the fake-wood paneled doors... the door to our room stuck, requiring you to throw your shoulder into it to open it, which produced this horribly loud noise as it rubbed against the door frame. The decor in the room wasn't bad, good furniture choices, but the bathroom was small, and the carpet had several stains all over it. Made me afraid to walk around barefoot. I took the blanket off the bed to line the couch with before I'd sit on it, as it looked well used. Staff were nice enough. We only booked there because we were dining at O.Noir (which was awesome by the way), but for anyone else thinking along the same lines, there must be several nicer hotels within walking distance of this restaurant. You should book one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trevandash
Reviews.Content: It looks nothing like their website, rooms are very dirty, loud partying going on through the night, door did not close properly, items in kitchen were greasy. We will never stay at this hotel again - completely misrepresented on their website - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed154981
Reviews.Content: Yes it was inexpensive but really lacking. Some lamps not plugged in and no outlets nearby, No alarm clock. No bedspread - froze so I took bedding off 2nd bed. Maybe three channels on television (snowy). If I had brought our children for a holiday would have been extremely disappointed. Garbage on the balcony. Red stains on the bathroom door (delightful). Bathroom fan sounded dangerous. Drawers in furniture didn't fit properly and no stand to put luggage on. No information about the hotel in the room like how to get Internet or is there room service etc.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Room Photos”
Reviews.Author: tjremedy
Reviews.Content: they did not do a good job converting this apartment building into a hotel. it pretty much is an apartment with key cards. not a hotel recommended for a romantic evening, more for a cheap place to pre-drink and crash with a group of friends on a budget. rooms are spacious and location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but not clean”
Reviews.Author: muskokawedding
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town Inn Suites recently, and while the room was very big, the couch smelled moldy and made us itchy. The carpet felt really dirty and the fridge was disgusting. The balconies are falling apart and items around the suite felt greasy. The only thing this place has going for it is it's downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Yogesh04
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Suite for almost one month with my wife and son and have found this place to be extremely good. It has everything a family person looks for; a spacious room with a kitchenette, an exercise room and a swimming pool with Sauna Bath. The staff is extremely cordial and courteous. All staff people have been very helpful. My special thanks to Maged, Mike and Tony for making my stay comfortable here. I look forward to stay in this place again and would recommend highly for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: lexicon828
Reviews.Content: We found Town Inn Suites to be sufficient for our needs, a great location near Bloor & Yonge, cafe's restaurants, transport etc. The hallways were being renovated but after 2 days they finished our floor so it was no disruption to us. Our one bedroom apartment was clean and up to date with a nice balcony and all amenities. They don't supply toasters in the rooms and our stove/oven was not working but a quick call to reception and in no time the maintenance guy was there and we were back in business. We both got bites on our legs and feet (maybe fleas or mites in the carpet) but everything else was great. Comfortable bed, ample bathroom with good water pressure. There is a coin operated laundry on Basement level. They charge $12 a day for Wi-Fi but we opted to go across the street to the cafe where there was free wi-fi, very handy. All in all, a pleasant experience, friendly and polite staff, and our room was serviced daily. Definitely would stay here again and would highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “We like to come back”
Reviews.Author: MaaikeBrouwer
Reviews.Content: We spent the Christmas Holidays in a 4 person suite. The apartment was spacious and cosy. When we arrived it was not superclean, After a complaint it was well cleaned the next day. We enjoyed our stay because we had plenty of room and the location is just perfect. Close to subway, dozens of restaurants and little shops. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included in the price but the location very unattractive, so we prepared our own. Kiitchen utilities, esp. frying pan could be better. We had a very pleasent stay, the place offers good value for money, but don't expect too much luxury or fancy decoration. If we are to visit Toronto again, we'll certainly book here.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: schmoopies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Town Inn suites for several years now. We just recently visited Toronto again on our anniversary and once again stayed at the Town Inn Suites, Room very clean, comfortable, we stayed in the king suite, and have previously stayed also in the jr suite, both accommodations are perfect. You can go do a quick grocery shopping right around the corner and cook in your room, everything you need to use is right in the room. Comfortable beds, little balcony but nice. They just did a little upgrade and a wonderful job they did. Staff very friendly and helpful. Nice Pool, and workout room. A parking garage with a heated ramp so easy to get the car out in the winter, but a charge for parking. There is parking around the area but i felt better having the car parked at the Hotel. Either way you would have to pay for parking. It is a little further up on Younge street but its a nice walk to the Eaton Center, with all kinds of shops and restaurants to look at as you walk down the road. If walking is a problem just around the corner is the subway. When we get there we don't see our car till we are ready to leave. I felt safe walking around in the area. I highly suggest if your looking for a comfortable place, downtown, and affordable this is the place to stay. I really think once you stayed you will come back. It isn't a Holiday Inn, nor is it a Marriott, its a Home away from Home. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, It is not what they claim,nor what the pictures say!!!”
Reviews.Author: valbushey
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay some where ,we could relax,being a suite, i thought that it was a good prices, i checked out the picture online,and they seemed nice. My daughter had been very ill, and was still very weak, we needed early check in,because we drove through the nite, when we arrived they not only didn't have early check in ,we didn't even have a room. They said they were over booked. Well if i drive 11 hours , it is not what i wanted to here. They couldn't help us out ,they said sorry we are over booked you have to wait,In the mean time i asked to see what the rooms looked like. The smelled of smoke and dirty people. Not a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent very affordable hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jpgiraud
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel, which was also the lodging for the Cuban band that was performing in Toronto that evening. Our room was extremely well appointed, with a pull-out sofa-bed (all made up) for our son in the adjoining sitting-room, and a fully equipped kitchenette. All the furnishings were spotlessly clean and fresh. The staff downstairs were efficient and friendly, and the underground parking garage very convenient. A very successful stay in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms very dated”
Reviews.Author: swdoctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the upscale area of Toronto's Younge/Bloor shopping area at prices much less than some of the other hotels in that area. Has a nice lobby, pool, and convenient drive up parking/unloading area. That is where the cudos stop. It is very dated even tho they have tried to update certain aspects. Ancient elevators that take 10-20 minutes to get to you and stop at every floor. Loud noisy parties with little damping of noise from the laminate floors. The rooms/suites are generous in size. very generous-as they were 40 years ago (when the hotel was probably built). They have kitchens, separate bedrooms, etc. If you have a large group of people to house or party with-it is probably perfect because of the size of rooms....if an elegant stay is what you are looking for-look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Oversizedluggage
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review-perhaps I'm still cranky because I couldn't get any sleep. First, my pillow was so big you could have stuffed a full size adult in the pillowcase. I paid for an "Executive Suite" with a bedroom and 2 beds-but they squished both beds in the same small bedroom. We had to wait 15 minutes for every elevator trip. The ice machine (yes the only one in the hotel evidently) was broken. Housekeeping would not bring extra towels. Really, for $240/nite-this place was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: COOLGUY96MFD
Reviews.Content: Really not one to write reviews but I fell the need to warn people about this place. We were traveling with 2 families of 5 and were going to a baseball game and the hockey hall of fame and was told this place was within walking distance to both. Not!!!!!!! This hotel is in the worst part of Toronto and when you are traveling with 6 kids all under 12 that is not a good thing. Check in time was at 3 but our rooms were not ready till 4:30. We went to walk around while we waited but had to go back inside because there were things seen that was to much to explain to young children. The rooms and hotel itself was nasty. Ripped carpet and furniture. Just gross in every way. I could go on and on and list everything bad about the hotel but it is easier to list the good things........NOTHING !!!!!!!!!!!!!! JUST DON'T STAY HERE !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: debbieeeee
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly although the maid service wasn't always on time but we weren't that fussy about it anyway. The location was perfect - a nice 10-15 minute stroll to central downtown (Eaton centre) and you're right on the street of the gay part of Toronto as well. Swimming pool was warm and water seemed clean, good size. Didn't use the gym but seemed clean and the basic equipment were there. We had a two bedroom suite and the layout was great, plenty of channels on the TV with good reception and an excellent view. If you're not overly fussy on the details, COME HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: davidtucker91
Reviews.Content: My friends and I took a trip to Toronto earlier this month. After reading nasty reviews on this hotel, we decided to stay here anyway. For 100$ a night, we landed a penthouse suite. After a couple of days with no maid service, we made a complaint and they gave us free internet for the remainder of our stay. When the internet on our floor didn't work, they moved us to the second floor in an executive room. There are no pictures of this room on trip advisor, but the room was amazing. Apart from that, the service at the front desk was impecable. The staff was always glad to help. The location of the hotel is located on the same street as the Church Wellesley Village (gay village), which didn't cause any problems because the atmosphere was rather secure and nice. The hotel is in he heart of downtown Toronto (excellent nightlife). I would definitely recommend this hotel to people visiting Toronto. It is a home away from home, with superb value!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Rainy81
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was fine there was just one or two things that let it down. The hotel had a fusty smell you had to pay to use the wi-fi and the AC unit was very noisey. Apart from that the staff are nice and helpful the location is really good. I just think it needs a lick of paint and a good deep clean and it'll be a great hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “The pictures lie!!!!!! It is nothing like you see in the pic, these folks should be charged for false advertising!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeousHamilton
Reviews.Content: Go on Priceline - bid on a 4 star hotel, pay 100US a night and have a great time!!!! Dont stay here - stove is 100 years old - BRING YOUR OWN POTS & PANS& DISH DETERGENT AND KITCHEN TOWELS .....HECK!!!!!....BRING EVERYTHING EXCEPT beddings and hot and cold water!!!!!!!!! ..bugs walking on kitchen cupboards,

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST EVER STAFF AND SUITE”
Reviews.Author: captaincook98
Reviews.Content: this hotel and its suites was the best thing that we experienced in toronto . the staff and housekeeping crew went out of thier way to make our stay a memorable and pleasureable experience with expertise in car rentals and front desk staff always on hand to assist in almost all capacities with smiles and genuine proffessional hospitality. the inn town suites is not deserving of reviews that once concerned me . rest assured you will be pleasanly surprised

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks”
Reviews.Author: disgusted1001
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dated. The carpets are filthy. The room we had looked like it was last decorated in the 1970s. Although our non-smokng suite did not smell like cigarettes, the hallway smelled like stale smoke and worse. The first night there were no wash cloths in the bathroom. The third day no one came to make up the room or leave fresh towels. Parking costs an extra $20 per night and the garage was filthy and looked like it was ready to collapse - there were support posts taking up many of the parking places. The day we arrived, we had to wheel our suitcases up stairs through fresh garbage juice. WiFi also costs an extra $12.95 per day. The only plus to this place is that the location is decent and within walking distance of some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Town Inn Suites Hotel, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: fareed_dossary_2255
Reviews.Content: From the first moment you enter your room in Town Inn Suites in Toronto downtown, Canada, you will feel the bad smell from the carpet and you will ask yourself how I can continue my stay in this hotel? There are 3 elevators, one of them is not working and the other two are very slow and you need about you need 3 to 5 minutes to wait for the elevator. The AC unit is too old, noisy and not cooling well. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The only good thing about this hotel is the location at downtown where you can easily visit most city attractive locations and find shopping centers and restaurants. For myself, I will not stay in this hotel in future and I do not recommend it for others. The only good thing about this hotel is the location at downtown where you can easily visit most city attractive locations and find shopping centers and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Old Dorm Room”
Reviews.Author: djrgreene
Reviews.Content: Clearly, this place used to be student housing. That, and and of itself would not justify the negative rating. So here is my summary: -- The place smelled bad. It smelled like they had repeatedly used one of those carpet cleaners you get at the hardware store. -- Aside from a coffee house and an Indian restraunt. very bad options for food. -- Bad options for TV -- Unkept bathroom -- 70's era kitchenette

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kadonaldson
Reviews.Content: after having read a few bad reviews we arrived to be taken to the 15th floor.our room had a huge balcony,huge living room,huge bathroom with great shower,huge bedroom,fitted kitchen and 3 large fitted wardrobes.it was a great place to stay and very central.staff were more than friendly,night and day.will definately be back again. p.s also a fantastic restaurant....

Reviews.Title: “If they would just deep clean the rooms....”
Reviews.Author: neon645
Reviews.Content: I feel bad writting a negative review on this place because the staff was crazy nice. The room however, was terrible. The carpet had tons of stains, the fridge didn't close all the way, there was clearly a smoking room below us and we could smell smoke often and the bathroom was beyond nasty. There were smears of something on the walls and there were pubes on the towels and hair in the bed. We went down to the front desk and asked if they had any updated rooms available (they are slowly remodeling), but they didn't. Then we asked for new towels and sheets and a huge stack of each were brought up within 10 minutes. This hotel is located in the gay district of Toronto, which I didn't think would be an issue, but it streets around the hotel really are gross. The staff is ridiculously nice and helpful. If you could get an updated room, then I think this hotel would be acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly old room & forced out of bed VERY early...what a bummer.”
Reviews.Author: ChinoTbay
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd get a deal w/ Travelzoo and stay at the Town Inn Suites. I got a very uninviting room on the 14th floor. An old apartment really...in skid shape. Urine smell in elevator, dirty windows, broken door leads you to gross deck outlooking terrible tennis court, broken remote for TV, plug-in hanging out of wall in washroom, duct tape holding tub together...& water in between the tubliner and tub was very odd. I had a long day and late flight, so requested a late check out..they said I can stay till 1pm. Come 7:30 or 8AM...LOUD and constant banging from below my bed! I called down to the front desk to a lady who said no such thing was going on. After calling again and letting her hear for herself, she said she'd have a manager take a look. At the 3rd call she said yes there was work going on, and no it would not stop. WTF!? I asked to speak to the manager, she said he was not there (she was lying) I could not get back to sleep so had an awful shower and left. When I got to the front desk to pay..There was the missing manager! I had to argue w/ this guy for 10 mins just to get a $20 refund. My entire day was ruined because I was so tired...I HATE THIS HOTEL! (still waiting to see why my visa says "Current Available Credit: $0.00", but I'll assume the worst w/ this place)

Reviews.Title: “Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: Lepeka
Reviews.Content: Hair in my bed. Ants throughout my room, internet did not work. They wouldn't give me a discount after complaining... moved to another room, where I also had the pleasure of hair in the bed. gross. never again. location's great though. hahaha.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: SW-travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of 3/19. After reading the reviews, we selected the Town Inn Suites because the rate was better than other choices & the location was excellent. Good points: - the desk staff & housekeeping were very friendly & helpful. We asked to change rooms because of the street noise in our 5th floor room & they agreeably moved us up to the 17th floor. - fabulous location - walking distance to excellent restaurants & subway. - the junior suite was large & it was nice to have a fridge - flat screen TV nice - the parking garage was fine Bad points: - the noise level was bad - seemed to be parties all over. Also, closing doors make a loud sound. Sleeping was difficult. - even though we were in a "renovated room", the bed was saggy; wallpaper peeling; dingy appearance. Not very nice. - the breakfast food was not very good & not much selection. - no safe in the room - I've been spoiled by other hotels having this safety feature.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the smell of cigarettes and cat urine”
Reviews.Author: tolerant1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night and we regret it. We knew right away that it was a dump from the filthy carpets and tired looking lobby. We persevered and checked in. We went to our room on the 14th floor. More disappointment.... the hallway to the room and our room smelled of cat pee and cigarettes. The bathroom had mould in it the ceiling had a repair job that looked as if a child had done it. To complete our night in this hotel we heard a man scream blue murder, then some running above our heads followed by the sound of sirens that sounded as if it was right outside our hotel. We were up and dressed {no shower as it was repulsive} by 7:30 am. The same unfriendly and distracted clerk was at the desk. She did not ask how our stay was so we silently checked out. The only good thing about the hotel was WE SURVIVED.

Reviews.Title: “Frat House”
Reviews.Author: shaddowland
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my daughter and grandson. It was our last visit before her deployment to Afghanistan with Canadian Military. From 10:00 p.m, on had to endure a loud party right below us. When I asked front desk to intervene they never got back to me and noise continued. Went to room myself at 3:30 a.m. Found at least 30 young people, intoxicated and partying in this suite., yelling from balcony, ect. No security around. They refused to acknowledge my complaint and noise continued. When we checked out in the morning advised front desk at what happend. No interest. Contacted manager and was told that since no one else complained that It was not an issue. I wanted a refund as we did not get any sleep plus cigarette smoke from below filtered into our suite. . He refused. I have to think that if that many people can get into the hotel for a night party then there has to be serious security issues.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: HWong1
Reviews.Content: I want to take this opportunity to thank the folks at the Town inn. When I arrived in toronto in the middle oa freezing cold spell I did not have the appropriate clothing ( being from Florida). The manager literally gave me his Jacket to go out and do some shopping. The hotel was good. My suite was very large for the price and the hotel was very well Situated. Thank you all at the Town Inn!! Henry

Reviews.Title: “high standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: newmind
Reviews.Content: Hilton Quebec is nice- located right next to the old town, and you could get a double room for 130$ on easy click travel web site. I sure do recommend it !! 196. Town Inn Suites is a high standard hotel, very well located, extremely comfortable, modern and clean. We enjoyed staying there- couldn't ask for more. This is surely one of the best hotels in the city, yet not expensive as other hotels that level. We booked it in last minute travel for a very attractive price. Truly recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “I am creating reasons to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FreshPink
Reviews.Content: I don't consider myself a Toronto person and I think I have stayed over night there once before in my life. My girlfriend and I needed an affordable place to stay last friday nite and the good people at Mirvish Productions recommended the Town Inn Suites. I owe them big time! The suite was amazing and I feel like I am not saying enough. We had everything we needed and the living, dining, kitchen areas felt like home (actually a nicer than my home right now - yeah reno's!). Waking up in the morning to a beautiful swim and sauna was just what I needed to blow out the february blaws. And what did this cost us you ask?? $200, $250, $300 - NOPE - WE STAYED RIGHT DOWNTOWN IN A KING SUITE FOR $120!!!! (And we could of stayed in a queen suite for $99. Louise and I are looking for a reason to get back to the city. Cheers, FreshPink

Reviews.Title: “Feel`s like home to us!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ricky900
Reviews.Content: For a few years now, when i travel to Toronto , i already know where i will be staying , The Town Inn suites! We are always greeted with a smile, check in is hassle free, and off to our oversize, spacious room, the largest room for your money by far. Days inn on Charles street is a case in point a 1/3 rd of the size of town inn suites, for about the same price. nice kitchen, i love to cook,, beautiful pool, sauna and steam room, all at the Town Inn suites, WHO COULD ASK FOR ANYTHING MORE!!!!!!! Charles l krebs

Reviews.Title: “NEVER staying there again! - Car vandalized in 'secure' underground parking”
Reviews.Author: BellstoneTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town Inn Suites on New Years Eve with a few friends. Although the price was descent for a large suite, I would never go back to the Town Inn Suites for a stay again. My first impression of the hotel was not a good one. The front desk staff seemed unorganized, unhappy, and almost frantic to check people in. We were checked in by the hotel's General Manager, who did not smile once and informed us that if our room received more than one noise complaint that we would be kicked out. Definitely not 'legendary' or 'warm' customer service that I would hope for from a hotel in Downtown Toronto. Although the hotel suite was large (as mentioned above), the room was extremely dated. The wallpaper was bubbling and even missing in some areas (had been ripped) and the kitchen appliances looked like they have been around for a few decades. My main complaint is about the underground parking. I parked my car in the lowest level of the 'secured' underground parking which you needed a swipe card to enter. When I returned to my car in the morning, the antenna had been removed from my roof, and my front grill had been completely ripped off... with a piece of my bumper removed. A total of $1190.00 damage. Looks like someone needed some car parts... or someone in a drunken state decided to vandalize my car. I was confident that my car would be fine as this was a secured parking garage. Very disappointed. I contacted the hotel and asked them to check the area for my car parts, and I also inquired as to whether there was a camera in that area that could have caught the vandals. The hotel informed me they would contact me within a few hours. 2 days later, still no response. I had to call back again to find out that my car parts had not been found, and that there was no camera to catch this. Moral of the story... don't stay at this hotel. It's ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Show”
Reviews.Author: salanS_Ontario
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only one positive and that is it's proximity to downtown. Just because it seems a good deal, do NOT get hooked in. The rooms are old and grubby with scaling paint on the walls. We had to ask for a crib (which was a dilapidated pack-and-play), sheets and bedding for the "crib" (which never appeared), extra towels (only two sets in a suite for 7 people), a coffee maker (which when it arrived was cracked and tiny). The heating was not working in two of the rooms and overbearingly hot in the other room. The shower was old and inefficient and the hot/cold faucets ran alternately freezing and boiling. To add to the negativity of our experience, valuables accidentally left behind in the room "disappeared". A minus 0 rating for sure. I will inform everyone I know who visits Toronto about this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating staff and very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: RBGTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Town Inn many times before as a solo traveler and based on their rates and the fact that we have 50% of our Sales Team in Canada we decided to have the conference there. We paid less that $95 per night and everyone got a suite. The Town Inn is not the Hilton or the Hyatt when it comes to the decor, It is older but clean, but the Staff I can safely say would hold their own at the Four Seasons. There was nothing that we needed that the Staff did not do for us. They were courteous and efficient. To often this goes unnoticed so I just wanted to say thank you publicly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fanatic007
Reviews.Content: We had a convention in Toronto and got a great bulk rate from the Town Inn. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. Location is excellent. Hotel is a little old but very good value. We each had our own suite.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: stokiebear
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place - Has all the basics you need without the five star price.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: SteffG
Reviews.Content: I was taking my niece and mom to see a few sites in Toronto. I booked the Town in b/c we wanted a suite (with kitchen) close to down town. The rate was OK....we thought....but not worth the money when we got there. The first room we were put in was absolutely disgusting...before I go on let me tell you that I am not a person to complain about much. I don't think its helps to grumble about things so I am a pretty positive person...I've read reviews where you think , gosh...some people will find anything to complain about, but that is not me.....ok, I will continue...the first room was dirty and gross. The bath mat was fused to the tub with a think ring of filth, the fridge and counter in the kitchen had food spilled and not cleaned. The sink facet did not work, the bathroom door did not cloths, the bed comforters were stained, the carpet was ripped and missing in places and stained. There were burn marks on the bathroom sink, kitchen counter and carpet....and the smell of the room was stale, smokey and dirty. We called the front desk immediately and they said they would look into having us moved. they called back asking them to come down to the lobby so we could get keys for a different room. The second room was decent (new flooring, no carpet, nicer linens, a little cleane)....however, first impressions are important and we could not shake the thoughts of the first room...not to mention, it was not what we had asked for - no full kitchen - I understand that it is an old apartment building that they are renovating into a hotel but why they would risk putting people in the rooms like our first is a terrible business move and for that I would not recommend...oh and the continental breakfast was pre packaged muffin, one kind, coffee and or tea

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: KMNCalgary
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! In the two nights that we spent there we had the luxury of experiencing four of their rooms. The first room had clearly just been occupied by a smoker, even though Ontario has been smoke-free for years. The second room's bathroom door did not close and there was no knob for the shower (which we didn't realize until 6:30am when we were running out the door). The room that they sent us to down the hallway to shower in was nice, but we couldn't stay there because it was already booked. The fourth room was clean and renovated (albeit poorly), but there were fans that blew from one room to the next, so when the partiers next door decided to smoke marijuana and cigarettes, we got to partake also. When we called to the front desk to find out how to turn the fan off, they didn't seem to care that people were smoking, but they were very friendly in describing where to find the fan switch. There are lots of hotels in this area, so other options exist.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag but all things considered, decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ElaineCSmith
Reviews.Content: Travelling with family and were in Toronto for a week in October so we booked an executive suite which consisted of two bedrooms, bathroom, lounge/dining area and kitchen. At first glance the suite was relatively modern but upon closer inspection it was fairly easy to notice flaws in the space. We aren't a particularly fussy bunch so it wasn't a great problem but for those who are interested, the issues we did encounter were: ants in the kitchen (dealt with by hotel staff no problem), unclean bathroom on arrival (wasn't in too bad condition and didn't take us long to clean up but had the maid spent an extra 5 mins in there all would have been fine) and one of the bedrooms didn't have its own radiator and relied on a vent (between the two bedrooms) pumping warm air to the other. Not ideal for privacy but again not a big problem. Aside from the cleanliness issues outlined above, we generally found the hotel a good place to stay. The bed's were comfortable, the location good, the local area safe and hotel staff (mostly) helpful. Quite a good option for a family travelling on a budget. Again, for those who are interested, the gym area and business centre (one computer in quite a public space) aren't upto much but the pool was handy for a quick swim and not too cold. In fact, had a swim most mornings. Overall we didn't have too many complaints about the hotel but if you are the type of person who finds the type of minor flaws mentioned in this review as a problem then I'd probably suggest looking elsewhere. Afterall, it isn't worth spoiling your trip if your that about uncomfortable with where you sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the fussy”
Reviews.Author: cheap_cheerful7
Reviews.Content: This property is in a convenient location downtown on Church street, it's close to the subway on Wellesley or north on Bloor..walking distance to Eaton Centre about 5 blocks give or take once you get onto Yonge street which is at the other end of the block where the Hotel is...or about 2 blocks away from Bloor street..There is a Rabba ( convenience store ) just around the corner on Isabella street, great for getting grocery supplies to keep in apartment / suite.. nice little coffee shop / lounge just across the street from Hotel...I'd read quite a few reports on this property but still decided to check it out myself..the rooms are nothing fancy, were clean, lots of cupboard space, no in-room safe ( available at front desk ), iron & board, dark furniture, dark wood floors, some scratched floors in living room area, attention needs to be given to kitchen supplies as far as crockery & cutlery goes.. as there weren't enough..regardless if it's 1 or 2 people staying in a suite there should be at least 2 of everything,,spoons, forks, knives, glasses, coffee cups, cereal bowls, plates, etc. and I stayed in 2 different rooms the Junior suite and the Executive King suite and experienced the same lack thereof.. the tubs in both rooms had this small area that looked like someone tried to dig something out of it..and they didn't do a very good job trying to patch it up.. better yet maybe they should replace the tub..the balconies off of the rooms leave a lot to be desired..I just stepped out on to see how cold the day was feeling and went back in..the a/c in the living room has to be on as there is a small vent that filters off this going into the bedroom area..my first room was on the 12th floor..the carpet as you exited the elevator and continued on walkway to your room was in bad shape...got much better on 24th floor..can't say I had to wait long for elevator..full mix of clients..people in town for business...pleasure...weekend getaway...flight crew.. I know people have said oh it's close to the gay village..if it bothers you... you don't have to walk downtown through church street,, just go the opposite direction to Yonge and you'll be on your way. Front desk staff pleasant enough..Mageed ( sorry for spelling ) was by far the star of whom I met there..
