Underground parking convenient but a little dodgy..exposed overhead pipes..Pool area decent enough..heated...this property is good for singles, families, groups of friends, or anyone looking for decent self contained accommodations in downtown area..For what you're paying you can't expect 4 star luxury..so don't go with those expectations.. but just make sure your room is in order :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Jarpeople
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel in the world. This place ruined our trip to Canada and was so bad we are trying to block out ever going to Toronto. The Rainbow district itself was not one suited to a young family and whilst I have no gripe on that front, it just compounded the problem. The "hotel" itslef is so old and so run down, that park benches look more attractive. If you like mould, smells and feeling like you are in a half way house then this is the place for you. It is actually beyong restoration and should be closed down. We were booked for two nights but left after one and stayed instead at the Novotel in town, which was so much more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Ewww - The only thing missing was a coin operated box to shake the bed”
Reviews.Author: Jay444
Reviews.Content: 21st floor, near the elevators I blame myself for staying here... I really should have read some reviews before booking with this hotel. Got a "Sale" price on this hotel and at $89, it was over-priced. I was expecting way more than what we got. The good: *Web site looked good (aka: it looks WAY better on-line) *Almost all the lights worked in the room *There was no lack of hot water, in fact, there wasn't enough COLD... burn caution *Lobby looked decent *Staff were polite *Free wifi but it's everywhere in major cities now anyway *Early check-in wasn't a problem (and perhaps that's why were were in such a poor room?) The bad: *What is that smell? *What burned that 10" circle in the carpet? *I don't think the fridge is supposed to drip like that inside *Either the bed was sloped, or the entire room was, I still can't figure that one out. *Hair dryer wiring must be defective because it worked for about 30 seconds before *No room safe but my guess is thieves will rarely frequent a low-budget place like this *Not once were we asked how our stay was, my guess is the staff are afraid of what the answers will be Location wasn't good for our needs, we wanted to me more in the entertainment district but that's our fault; I was rushed when booking. End result, we should have booked closer to the water front and paid the extra $50 or $60 for something closer to our needs and tastes.

Reviews.Title: “I was unpleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: JoeMCanada
Reviews.Content: I understand that this is a 3/5 rated place to stay, but the counter tops in the kitchen had several permanent marks and stains, the TV was smaller then my computer monitor and you need to use an attached game controller to change the channels, the bed was very bumpy, the comforter case was broken open, the toaster, kettle, and stove were really old, the shower water was very inconsistent from very cold to very hot. If they took sometime to freshen the place up and take care of it each and every day it would be a much nicer place to stay. Also, the experience was even worse because I booked it last minute and paid more then I wanted to, and it was Toronto International Film Festival Weekend. I would have felt better if I only paid $80. I stated I would not recommend this place to a friend based on all the above, I would tell a friend not to pay more then $50-$70 and it is more like a 1 or 2 rated place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wmaureen
Reviews.Content: A family with young children I was very disappointed with the cleanliness of this hotel I was very afraid my children were going to catch something or a bug was going to appear when i slept. The pool area was very dirty and the washrooms in the pool area were frightening. The free breakfast was a joke we went to the restaurant and waited for 15 min to be looked at, no coffee and the juice was 2.00 not included in the breakfast. What are kids supposed to drink coffee? Then we ordered and it was a muffin and apple we were so disgusted in the service we just left. This hotel is in great need of a update I felt i never got my value for my money!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: EMax57
Reviews.Content: This place is basically on par with a room in a YMCA in 1962. The carpet is very old and smelly. Smells of cigarette smoke everywhere. Internet costs extra and works only a couple hours a day. 5-10 minute waits for elevators, which sometimes just skip your floor. Doors that don't close. Exposed electrical wiring. Old dirty furniture. Heat A/C that is so loud you can't sleep, and it doesn't work. Staff who are ill-informed and overworked. Location several miles from downtown. The only thing good was that the manager really tried to do his best. But this place is just beyond the pale. And it is nice to have a kitchen. I wouldn't mind so much if there were truth in advertising. It should have one star, and be clear that it is far from downtown. Then you would know what you were getting into. But this is not the case. The people who gave this inn 5 stars cannot possibly be serious.

Reviews.Title: “Sloppy but Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BlueStevox
Reviews.Content: The location was great for doing public transportation. It was only two blocks from a major subway interchange and was one block from lots of food and a drug store. The carpet and furniture were cheap and very worn. The staff was friendly but would often forget to follow through on small requests. Overall, the place was fine and got the big stuff right. It was the small details that makes this place a little unprofessional and unkempt.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: sugar37Ottawa
Reviews.Content: When I asked my husband about hotel accommodations he said, it doesn't really matter were we stay as long as it is clean and close to downtown Toronto. Well, it was neither!!! When we saw the hotel it didn't seem to bad from the outside, but when you walk in it is instantly obvious that it is no Best Western!!! I am comparing it to the Best Western because, The Town Inn Suites doesn't even come close to being the Hotel that 2 and 3 stars hotels are!! There is no rating for this hotel, It was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in many hotels all over the world!!!! Honestly I was going to pass out because all my planning and researching not to mention how many hours we drove and this was the hotel we were going to stay in!! Like my teenage daughter said "This place sucks", and we stayed in the so called executive suite. Don't waste your money or time looking at the pics on there web site because really looks are deceiving in this case!!! Try the Crowne Plaza about 12 minute drive north of the downtown that is were we salvaged what was left of our vacation and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and convienent”
Reviews.Author: lemencass
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and was a little apprehensive, my budget dictated my location. The one bedroom suite was our choice as it had a pullout. The bedroom was just like the picture as was the sitting area and kitchen. The decor is somewhat tired but when on holiday how much time do you spend in a room anyways to be looking at the decor? I went away to do things so this suited us just fine. The bathtub had been painted in spots yes,the hall carpets a wee bit tired,the elevators slow but lets face it you get what you pay for. There was an old mattress in the closet for which we were grateful for as the pullout was small enough ,more like a small double really. We had a dining table for 4 and a kitchen table for 2 which was great as the other 3 hotels we stayed at had 1 or 2 chairs or the 4 of us so we ate in shifts! The T.V.s worked fine,the phone was expensive as tax is added to all calls regarless of the duration. The internet is expensive but it is everywhere else too,in Florida it was nearly $5.00/hour so $10 a day is not bad. I would not bother bringing my laptop again as it was usless to me in the end. The pool is a salt water pool and was a welcome treat after a hot day,towels are down at the pool and it is generally empty. We brought drinks from our room and sat on the outside deck while the children swam,what more could you want. The elevators are no slower than most apartments considering the volume of people who stay. The housekeeping staff keep the cleaning trolley in the hall and we asked that we not be disturbed for the week and we cleaned ourselfs,we simply went to the staff and got was required for the day. If I was staying again I would bring some basic essential items,dishwashing liquid,a cloth for dishwashing, tin foil,fabreeze(it was expensive there) and powder for washing your clothes as there are machines. I would also check the room upon arrival should there be anything you may require and the staff will get it for you. When I needed a can opener it did take some time to get one,I needed a larger pan and a roasting dish would have been nice too,so if you have an idea just make up your list before hand. There is a Metro shop down church which is a larger supermarket that I discovered on my last night which is cheaper than the shop on Isobella. The main subway is within walking distance beside the chemist and other shops. There is a pub just up the street that has nightly specials,I had a quesadea with fries and a pint for $11. plus tax,not a bad deal. The LCBO is the off licence located at the subway too. The air con was loud but it was at every hotel I stayed at and it did drown out the noise of the city so this was nearly comforting to kids who are not used to the noise level. All in all I would go back after having stayed in other cheap places in Toronto this was the best of the cheap for us, a friend travelled with me and she too would stay there again. I guess I feel a little defensive of the place as some reviews paint it as a hovel to be avoided at all costs. I don't bother renting a car any more as parking is generally $18-25 a night plus the rental,plus insurance,plus parking charges while out and tolls. It is cheaper to take taxis or public transport. We took the Go train to Niagra falls for a fraction of the cost of a car rental.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap, bad service”
Reviews.Author: nortongoblin
Reviews.Content: The location is good, close to Yong street. You will get a suite with additional bedroom which is great for the trip with young kids. The cleaning service is bad and so the breakfast. You will have to pay for the parking (18$) which is not so bad relatively to the price of public parking. Overall, you can probably find a much better place for additional small extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst accomodation ever”
Reviews.Author: CosmoMontreal
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern, be aware that this hotel is overestimated and overpriced. Any price is in fact too high to pay. I booked 2 nights and had the worst traveling nightmare. I canceled the second night on the spot. I only stayed for the first night because I arrived too late to go anywhere, in an unknown city for me. The hotel is dirty, smelly, badly administered. It's really a shady place. Everything is old and dirty, you feel like everything is falling over you: the ceiling, the walls, even the underground parking is badly affected by water leaking. This is worse than a highway drive-in motel. I don't have enough words to describe how bad this hotel really is. The so-called "business center" (which is actually made of one computer in a narrow passing hallway, with no doors) charges $5 for 10 minutes. You will probably end up paying $10 just to look up another hotel, so you can get the hell out of there asap. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Inaccurate Pictures”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelsOZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel...granted, we made the mistake of booking it from overseas and relied on the pictures but it was really disappointing. Our 2 bedroom suite had filthy carpet, a horrendous odour, torn linen, filthy windows and the list continues.... Sure, we weren't expecting the Westin but we did expect to be able to feel like we were staying in a clean, neat and liveable suite as advertised. The hotel looks nothing like the pictures at all...it is a rundown and dilapidated hotel. Never in a million years would we recommend this place to anyone. Overall a really big disappointment- in future we would rather stay at a hostel than a dirty place like that.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Run down”
Reviews.Author: Family_Dad_2009
Reviews.Content: Consider this a warning to those who want to stay here. This is a VERY run down place. While the price makes it look attractive, when you actually get there it is a different story. I booked a 2 bdrm suite for 2 nights based upon their website and a coupon. I paid about $180 Cdn each night. When I parked my car, I was more concerned about the roof caving in on the parking garage then thieves breaking into my car. Secondly, it took 4 tries to get a room that was deemed acceptable. The original room smelled soo bad even with the window open, the second room was cleaner but the bathroom has in decripit shape. The third room was a one bedroom suite with a cot and a king side bed in the same room and the fourth has stained carpets, stained furniture, but was deemed clean enough for us to stay the 2 nights. There were no airconditioning in each of the 2 bedroom only 1 in the living room that made so much noice, we couldn't sleep. Thank God it wasn't that warm outside. One look at their indoor pool was enough for us to change our minds and wait to swim when we got home. My advice to anyone who reads this is the following.... Dig deep in your pockets and find another place to stay in Toronto. Don't ruin your vacation by staying here and wondering if they actually clean the bedding or just remake the bed. Yuck. I've learned my lesson. I'll stay at a named hotel from now on. Atleast I can feel sure that my money is being invested in the up keep of the hotel. At the Town Inn, I felt that my money was lining the owner's pockets while the dingy walls continue to decay before my eyes. Find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friends don't let friends stay at the Town Inn Suites.”
Reviews.Author: lovenegril09
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. God. First off, we are NOT picky people when it comes to hotels/motels. We've actually stayed at sub-par motels before and didn't flinch. But this is a whole different level. We stayed in a 1 BR "suite." It was terrible from start to finish. I opened the closet door when i walked in and found a bunch of old mattresses stored in there. The furniture and carpeting was at least 20 years old. The bed seemed to be even older. We didn't even sleep under the covers because we were afraid what we'd find under there. It was so outdated and grungy. Stains covered the bathroom tub and sink. They didn't provide facecloths. The air conditioner was extremely loud and didn't work. Keycard didn't work.. The elevators took forever. Parking cost an additional $18 per night and the door didn't always open. Wireless internet cost $10 for 24 hours, and that rarely worked. It was just one thing after another. It's one thing for a hotel to be outdated, but it should be clean and guests should be made a priority. Not so much here. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Fabioh-no
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1BR suite in late July. From our balcony on the 23rd floor, we had a great view of Church Str all the way to the lake. The size and space was adaquate for our family; clean but dated. However, it appeared that the bathroom had been updated within the past five years although the ceiling hadn't been touched nor had the door/frame been replaced. As long as they were replacing the door knob, the least they could have done was replace it with one that locks. Newer refrigerator; older stove and the rest of the furniture and carpeting. Underground parking helpful and convenient - reasonable rates (I believe $15 USD or thereabout). Good deals to be had on-line...ours was about $100/night. Strategically located a block east of Yonge Street just north of the epicenter of activity (about a 20 minute walk to Yonge-Dundas Square). Staff were attentive, courteous and helpful. Housekeeping did a fine job. Breakfast was included: we received two vouchers (upon request) which we redeemed the next morning for two pre-wrapped muffins, an apple and coffee (that's per voucher...we could have chosen two slices of bread instead of the muffins - so there ARE options...) The next two mornings - didn't even bother....with a kitchenette, we had our own food anyway. Elevators were slow but we were never in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Grungy but affordable”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel five times. Once we stayed in a lovely, renovated suite; other times the rooms were clean and spacious but a little tired-looking. This time, however, the room was really shabby. We stayed on the 11th floor. Got off the elevator and right away things didn't look so good. Hallway rug was stained, and a garbage bag sat on the floor and stayed there for our entire visit. It appeared to be stuffed with towels. The carpeting in our room was stained, the counter in the kitchenette was stained, the volume button on the rickety TV set was broken so volume was very low, tiles in the bathroom were chipped and broken. There was only one glass in the kitchenette for our family to use, and two mugs, one of which had somebody's old coffee residue in it. There was a piece of litter under the bedside table, clearly visible. On the positive side, the staff were very helpful and friendly. And to be fair, we've stayed in much nicer rooms at this hotel. I'd recommend asking for a clean, renovated room; maybe you'll have better luck than we did. I recommend this hotel only because of the price, location, and the possibility that you might get a better room than we did; I know better rooms exist at this hotel. Has an indoor pool, which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Didger11
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a five star property but very good value for the money. The property is clean and the staff was very helpful. Very good location close to excellent shopping and dinning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: 30dayworld
Reviews.Content: The Elevator warnings about, slow had us worried .This was not the case. We never waited more than a minute . This being a wedding weekend we were in and out a lot and our suite was on the top floor . The first two suites did not have access to the balcony ,so we did request a change and they were very friendly and more than accomadating . We ended up with a very nice suite with a great north view . It was like being at home , not perfect but comfortable . friendly staff ,great location . I am sure when renovations are complete the rates will change .

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: JaysLover
Reviews.Content: I don't know what rooms the previous people were given, but I had an upgraded suite that I wouldn't have asked my worst enemy to stay in. I had no heat in my room and got no service even though I called down 3 times for it! I had no hot water! I was put in a smoking room, even though I requested no smoking and I reeked the next morning but couldn't shower the stench off! The continental breakfast is nothing more than a stale pre-packaged muffin and old coffee from a styrofoam cup. It was old, ugly, and the elevator takes more than 10 minutes to arrive to your floor. I was terrified on more than one occasion by some of the 'guests' on my floor... seems they may be offering an hourly rate that isn't advertised. All in all the worst stay of my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Homelike feeling at TownInn”
Reviews.Author: PeeNPee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at town Inn in March 2009. I have shifted there from Comfort Hotel as there was no kitched in Comfort and being vegetarian, I couldn't find much option for daily food. The main advantage of this hotel is that the kitchen in attached to the room. The room was also clean. Another advantage of this hotel is that it is very near to the Gay Villege.

Reviews.Title: “A warm, friendly, beautifully updated hotel with an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: KSearles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Town Inn for over twenty-five years. It is warm and beautifully updated with pool, sauna, and small fitness room. The staff is most helpful and over the years has become family. It is ieally located in downtown Toronto a block from the subway, two blocks from the ROM, and a fifteen minute walk from Eaton Center. It has coffee shops, McDonald's, and great restaurants within easy walking distance. All of the rooms are suites including living room , furnished kitchenette, and a bedroom. It is ideal for families. This is the only place that we stay while in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay with Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: luvTo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town Inn Suites from Apr. 1 to Apr. 29, 2009, taking advantage of their special monthly rate. The value was exceptional for an hotel in downtown Toronto. The suite was recently upgraded and was very clean and quiet. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The kitchen enabled me to prepare meals to fit a very restricted diet. Convenient laundry facilities in the building were clean and economical. I would readily stay there again and recommend the Town Inn Suites to friends.

Reviews.Title: “wow ( not the good wow )”
Reviews.Author: pepperw99
Reviews.Content: from the many reviews i looked over before going to this hotel, I must say i was still going in with a clear NEUTRAL opinion of it// while the price for a 2 bedroom exec. suite was 99.00 for a friday night in toronto that really was a great deal// From walking into the hotel , we were greeted immediately by the front desk staff member , i asked to view the room before we actually paid the money , he gave us our room key which was for floor 22 room 4 ,.. the elevator was very slow to get to the lobby, but we did arrive around 430 pm. // When we entered the room i did as what previous reviews stated , i checked around the room completely for any water damage, mould e.t.c // and what did i find in the first closet as well as the bathroom, A MOUSETRAP with its kill in it , as well mould... we returned downstairs and the employee apologized, and offered us a room on floor 12 room 1 , which my friends and i agreed would have to do, ... we returned downstairs and paid for the room, little did we know. the parking garage under this building costs 18.$ a night.. while entering the parking garage it should be noted that there are no mirrors and i almost did collide with the garage door because it started closing while i was under it// Parking was satisfactory// we went out for anight on the town, returned to find that our neighbours on both sides were also enjoying themselves, and we decided to join them,, we turned a stereo up as we were the only 3 rooms occupied on that floor and it was amazing, despite a lack of security when a fight broke out..and the police\ems had to be called in// when i disputed the parking charge with the manager prior to leaving for our night out the manager said " if you arent happy with the rooms we have as well as our parking you are more than welcome to leave this premises" not very good customer service in my opinion// the pool was not cleaned// the bathroom had soapscum .// definetly needs better staff & management.. as well the parking garage needs mirrors/

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient and very well priced”
Reviews.Author: StevieJOttawa
Reviews.Content: We had a meeting with a new supplier in Toronto and had to bring 6 people from the team. With the economy the way it is we needed something affordable. I was a little concerned as the price for a Suite seemed very cheap but was impressed went we arrived and we all had 2 bedroom suites. I have to say the breakfast was good, the pool and sauna were great. Thank you Maged and Valerie.

Reviews.Title: “great value and spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: giddie2
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the suites on extended business trips (from 1 to 6 months at a time) for the past 7 years. Its not the Hilton, that's for sure, but for an extended stay its a wonderful choice. I always had clean spacious suites. The carpets may be a tad worn, but the bed, linens & towels were excellent. The front desk staff are excellent, with special mention of Mag, Christine & Tony, who were always cheerful, helpful, and went out of their way to make my stay pleasant. As I said before, the decor is not up to the standards of a 5-star big-city hotel, but having a full kitchen with all appliances, a restful living room & separate bedroom with a second TV, and staff who greeted me by name every time I came back from work far out-weighed the lack of pretty wallpaper & pictures. Every room has a balcony which is a rare treat in the city, especially if staying for an extended period. The pool is clean, large, and has large doors opening onto a sundeck. The elevators are slow, especially at peak hours. The breakfast is now a full breakfast, either included with some rates, or available for $8.95. For downtown Toronto, that's a great deal. Eggs to order, french toast, cereals of all kinds, coffee & juice. Fresh fruit is available in the lobby. The location is perfect: close to the Gay Village, tony Yorkville & Bloor shopping areas, 2 blocks from the subway, walking distance to many great places to visit. Restaurants are plentiful nearby, but who wants that when you have a full kitchen? I think its a prefect place to stay for extended business travel, or for family vacations. I was so happy with the service & facilities, I recommended it to our Travel coordinator who then booked many of our employees into the suites for 2 week stretches. Everyone was happy with the rooms, staff & service.

Reviews.Title: “A place to put your head.”
Reviews.Author: rob_s_way
Reviews.Content: I/we have stayed at the Town Inn and Suites 3 â€“ 4 times. The type of suite you get depends on who/how you book your stay. Using a company such as Expedia/Travelocity may get you a â€œtop of the lineâ€� suite one time and then a basic the next. Same experience if you book directly with the company. This facility appears to be an original high-rise apartment building in Toronto that has been taken over and run like a hotel. You can stay for a weekend or months on end. There was a wide range of cleanliness in the various suites we stayed in. The range being gross (mouldy) to superb. All have a living room/dining room and kitchen with one or two bedrooms. Some are very spacious while others donâ€™t leave much room to swing a cat. We choose this facility in the past due to its closeness to the Gay Village in Toronto (Church and Wellesley area). It is handy to shopping and night life â€“ but so are many other hotels from which to choose. There are other hotels in the area with a much more consistent product on offer. We tried this hotel and will pass on it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Town Inn Suites, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteJohn001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Town Inn Suites for one month on business in December. I had read some reviews and was a little nervous, but my company already had me booked as the rate was so reasonable for a downtown hotel. I have to say I was happily surprised at the condition of the room, and the quality of the furnishings. The duvet was new and white and clean, the sofas were leather and in perfect condition, and the carpeting was fine. Wireless internet was fast. I wouldnâ€™t say it was a Hilton, but it was a great three star suite and I would definitely return. The staff was helpful and friendly, Mag the Assistant GM in particular, and it was very nice to have all the amenities of a suite, instead of just a hotel room with a microwave. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who will be in the city for an extended period of time from two days to two months as a great deal and nice place to stay downtown right near the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: explorerhamilton
Reviews.Content: My lady friend and I spent the evening in Torornto Jan10,2009. It was the worst experience we have had in a hotel . Rooms are way over rated, the Ymca would of been more pleasant. Believe me the pictures must of been from another hotel.Service was unacceptable , don't forget the hidden parking charges they say it will be taken care of when you get there. They only take care of themselves.My credit card was over charged for things I didn't sign for. When I recieved my statement there was other expenses added to my account with no explanation. If you want a pleasant experience oft the big city stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: hellloooo
Reviews.Content: From the pictures we saw on their website it seemed as though the hotel would be a nice higher end place. When we arrived they allowed us to check-in at 11am because we wanted to leave our car in the underground parking. The parking looked like it was about to fall apart. The pillars holding the garage up were sinking and falling apart and there were areas blocked off, basically didnt look safe to be there. When we got to our room it was not what we expected. The bedroom was nice, no complaints. The bathroom was a little rusty around the sink and the wallpaper was peeling. The living room area was ok. The tv stand was missing the drawers. The sink in the kitchen was broken: once you turned it on you had to replace the tap into its socket to make the water stop. We had a toaster and a coffee maker, the toaster looked old and unsanitary and personnally i wouldnt use it. The continental breakfast was not even a breakfast, was a snack, there was coffee, apples and muffins. THATS IT! I liked how many channels the tv had. Also, the room was really clean. Basically, the hotel needs some major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but needs a face lift”
Reviews.Author: Shnoune
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my 4 year old niece. Staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful. Thoe hotel has a luggage check if you get in to town early. The room itself was a little run down, and had I not gotten a good deal with the website I used to book the room, this might have upset me. Overall though, the room was clean,bedsheets clean, etc. But the tub needs to be refinished, some spots stained into the carpet and slight damage to the drywall in places. The subway is a 5 minute walk, and the airport about a 75 minute public transit ride away, downtown less than 30 and about an hour to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Senj
Reviews.Content: The WORST hotel we stayed in, during a five week holiday in Canada. We booked a two bedroom suite for 2 adults and 3 children. Our suite, on the 19th floor, had wallpaper hanging off, big damp patches, a filthy carpet and a rusty bath. There was a large piece of concrete hanging off the balcony above ours. Upon complaining, our suite was changed for one more inline with those on the internet. It was only one small room with non-lockable windows, despite being within acess of public spaces. Nonetheless, we were charged the rate for the original double room and told the room we had was an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk and Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: stuCt
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience in the Suites with the help from the Front Desk, Mr. Xiuwen Che, during our 2-day-1-night stay in Toronto. We appreciate greatly his patient, caring service and professinal advice for our trip plan and enjoyed indeed the Toronto stay and the tour. The hotel is located close to Royal Ontario Museum, a must-see attraction in Toronto, near by a subway station, a few blocks to the downtown within the walking distance, a few minutes' driving to Casa Loma and Ontario Science Center. Our room is pretty new, and neat, however it does not smell so. We did not eat the free breakfast provided by the hotel, yet heard of it is "too simple".

Reviews.Title: “Big Suite, Great Location....but outdated”
Reviews.Author: frisbear
Reviews.Content: We ended up here because the original hotel we booked through Hotwire could not provide a suite as promised. I quickly found this hotel. If you are looking for an affordable hotel in the key areas of Toronto, this would be OK. However, please read below to get a better picture of the hotel. The location is great....one block off of Bloor and Yonge. The 2-bedroom suite was spacious and had a very clean bathroom and sheets. The carpeting and walls had not been painted in years. No bad smells....but it just looked gross. (My wife did not allow our infant to crawl on the floor.) There was only one TV in the main room, not in any bedroom as promised. One of the bedrooms did not have air-conditioning. Kitchen was fine but a microwave would have been nice. The hallway of our floor had worn, stained carpeting. The hotel maintanance staff left their cleaning cart and vacuum in the hallway all 5 days we were there. Each day towels and sheets were left with their supplies on the floor. If you are handicapped or use a stroller, this hotel can be a challenge. The hallways are narrow and windy, especially when you are going down to the "complimentary breakfast" or trying to access the parking garage. You will need to navigate steps and corners. There are no ramps. The continental breakfast was coffee, apples, and pre-packaged muffins. The elevators were very scary. They took a long time to get to our floor. The elevator doors closed very quickly. The door closed within 4 seconds on my 5 year old as I was pushing on a stroller. She was trapped by herself but with quick thinking we got her off.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: harryliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. I booked the hotel online for two families, one with 5 people and one with 4 people. I requested that the rooms be close to each other. I booked two king suites with one king bed and a pull out sofa. When we arrived they did not have 2 king suites. The young woman at the front desk told me that they couldn't accommodate our request and then proceeded to send us to four different rooms throughout the hotel to see if they were suitable - none of which could accommodate all of us. She finally found two suites, one, nice renovated one and one dirty, old one. We had no choice so we took it. They did agree to honour our original quote of $129/room. (the nicer suite apparently went for over $300). The other room was not worth the price. The staff was not helpful. The hallways and outside were not well maintained. The older room had disgustingly dirty carpet and the kitchen and bathroom was in dire need of being redone. Overall a bad experience. We often go to Toronto for a weekend or night and will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware”
Reviews.Author: tessAustralia
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given was nothing like the photos, old, dark and no internet connection. However the helpful young man at the front desk gave me a free upgrade when it was clear that I was unhappy. However - be aware - I was woken up at 6.15 am on the day I was checking out by someone purporting to be the management demanding I give my credit card details as they haven't been able to process my card. When I went down to the desk there were others who had had the same call. I acknowledge this is not the fault of the management or staff. There was also man who appeared drunk, with blood on his face, wandering in and out of the lifts which made me think security was really slack - this was about 6.30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as recent reviews would suggest”
Reviews.Author: Legaltranslator
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for one night. The staff was friendly but the front desk was understaffed for checkout. I was given a suite with a kitchenette that included a full stove, a fridge and a microwave. The amenities certainly represented value for the money at the Travelzoo Canada promotional rate. However, the bathtub's enamel was coming off in many spots, and there were dingy, unclean things in the living area (see photos). Based on the evidence, it looked like the suite had undergone renovations that were stopped suddenly before they could be completed, even though this left some of the things unsafe, and they can't seem to be bothered to replace things like a "soiled" lampshade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JamillaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, large rooms, amazing location! The kitchenette was perfect for our stay, and the indoor parking was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: deena234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Town Inn Suites in Jan 2008. Its a great hotel! Nice rooms, very clean and the staff are really nice. Had breakfast downstairs in the morning, it was delicious. I was very impressed with the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a treasure!!”
Reviews.Author: tta888
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Perfect location, great staff and beautiful rooms. The hotel feels like a modern boutique hotel, but at half the price AND with breakfast included. Just a short walk to all the city's great shopping, restaurants and nightlife. We are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: erinmary
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband's birthday. I wanted a suite with a kitchenette, and I found a great deal on travelzoo for this hotel, only $89 per night for a one bedroom, king bed suite with living room and kitchen. In downtown toronto, not bad. I was pleasantly surprised with the decor, very modern, very clean, looked very much like the hotel's website. Big comfy king size bed, flat screen tv, nice. Major downside was the oven, very old model, and it didnt work. The stove top did, but what I was cooking needed to be baked, bummer. Oh well, I used the microwave for somewhat less than fabulous results, but a broken oven wasn't enough for me to change rooms after I had made myself very comfortable. Another downside for us was that the television is in the living room, with no separate tv in the bedroom. My husband and I love watching movies in bed, so it was a little disappointing, but we managed of course. Overall though, a great value, super easy check in/out, clean, comfortable, modern rooms, a balcony overlooking the city, and underground heated parking [which came in handy since the weather outside was -8 degrees C]. I would stay here again, if my first choices were not available!

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: skotska
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and was surprised to see that its very run down, the rooms all need to be upgraded and the bathrooms need redone. There are some lovely staff and some not so lovely. The lifts were broken more than they were working so we spent loads of time sitting in the lobby waiting on them!!! The hotel is ideally situated but i would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: hithereUS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bad. It is in real need of repair. I did like the bed and the proximity to the subway, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LoriRob
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with two teenagers and wanted a two-bedroom suite, and my travel agent said that her comparison shopping showed this place to be the best deal in Toronto. I was a little nervous about what to expect after reading the reviews here, but fortunately I was pleasantly surprised and had an enjoyable stay there. What I liked: --- The spaciousness of the suite. Many two bedroom apartments aren't that big! --- The view from our balcony. One of my fondest memories is sitting on the balcony at night while an almost full moon hung over the city. --- The location. Being two blocks from the intersection of Yonge and Bloor (the busiest intersection in the city) was extremely convenient for walking around or taking the subway. --- The hot complimentary breakfast. Love those sausages! -- The people at the front desk. They were very friendly and helpful. I just wish they knew more about the local restaurants, however. What I didn't like: --- Our unit only had one bathroom and no microwave. --- While the rooms were nice and in very good condition, the outside balcony had peeling paint, etc. --- The wait for the elevators. I think I spent more time waiting for the elevators than I ever did waiting for a subway! Overall, I was very pleased and would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Town Inn Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 620 Church Street, Toronto, Ontario M4Y 2G2, Canada
